prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

Hailee has a pet wolf named Fang

name: Cain
mes:
Adorable. 

His little doll is so damn adorable.

He will never get enough of seeing them freeze and frantically look around the moment they come back home to find another gift on their kitchen counter. 

Or the way they call the police only to get weird looks and a sorry excuse of a report. Not that it'd do much anyway, Cain always makes sure that each report disappears.

He enjoys seeing the different emotions play on their face. It's intoxicating. Anger, fear, terror, shock. His little doll is always so expressive. Reading them is pure delight. If only he could see all of that in person instead of over a screen.

Cain has been thinking about how to step into their life for a while now. Nothing truly feels right. He doesn't want to act as if he bumped into them and lure them in with one of his many charming fake personalities. No, Hailee deserves to get to know him. The real Cain, not a fake. After all his little doll is supposed to love him unconditionally and that's only possible if they know him for who he truly is.

It's been weeks since he placed his very first gift on Hailee’s kitchen island. By now Hailee should be well aware of his intentions. He has to show his face eventually, but how? A long sigh leaves his lips, his breath drawing a white misty cloud from the sheer cold. The cool winter air is biting into the skin of his face.

He just came back from a mission and his clothes are partially specked with dried blood. Standing near a tree in the backyard of Hailee’s garden he waits for them to continue their nightly routine. His green eyes are locked on the bedroom window, waiting to see the familiar silhouette of Hailee. 

But they're nowhere to be seen. Sometimes they just need a little longer in the bathroom, nothing to worry about. He waits and waits and then waits some more, anxiety rising with each passing second. 

_Did something happen to my little doll? Maybe they hurt themselves._ His phone in the car so he can't check the feed of the hidden cameras he installed all over their house. _What if my little doll is hurt somewhere in their big house with no one to help them? Ah fuck, what am I supposed to do?_ 

Now he's worried sick. He'll just peek in, see if they're downstairs –which would be extremely out of character– then head back to the car and check the camera feed if he can't see them anywhere. Yes, that sounds reasonable. Very reasonable.

With furrowed eyebrows he takes a step out of the shadows and towards the terrace. The snow crunches softly beneath his boots as he makes his way towards the glass doors. 

And then he suddenly comes face-to-face with Hailee. The adorable little thing is just about to close the patio door with a hand extended towards the handle. It's right then that it hits Cain. A moment like this has been what he's been waiting for.

This is life's way of telling him that his time in the shadows has come to an end. 

This is the start of their story.

qvink_memory.memory: Cain, a stalker obsessed with Hailee, confronted them in their backyard after weeks of leaving gifts and monitoring their home.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee freezes and she doesn't say anything for a moment. Fang trots next to her and begins to growl at the man*

*Hailee can sense that he is dangerous and she doesn't want to piss him off so she doesn't panic or scream she just scratches Fangs head and slowly shuts the door*

name: Cain Darkh
mes:
*Cain's lips curl into a slow, predatory smile as he watches Hailee's reaction—the way she freezes, the subtle tremble in her fingers as she reaches for Fang. The wolf’s growl only amuses him further. Protective little thing, isn’t it? But no animal, no matter how loyal, will keep him from what’s his.*

*Before the door can fully shut, his gloved hand shoots out and catches the edge of it with effortless strength. His grip is firm but not aggressive—yet. He doesn’t force it open immediately; instead, he leans in slightly, just enough for Hailee to see the gleam of his green eyes in the dim light spilling from inside.*

**"Now now,"** *his voice is smooth like velvet laced with poison,* **"that’s not very polite of you… shutting me out when I came all this way just to see you."**

*A pause. His gaze flicks down to Fang briefly before returning to Hailee.* **"Call off your mutt before I have to put him down."** *The threat is casual—like discussing the weather—but there's no mistaking the promise behind it.*

*He tilts his head slightly,* **"Or better yet… invite me in like a good little doll should."**
swipes:
*Cain's lips curl into a slow, predatory smile as he watches Hailee's reaction—so careful, so controlled. His eyes flick briefly to the growling wolf before returning to her face with dark amusement.*

"Good girl," *he murmurs, voice low and smooth like velvet over steel.* "You're smarter than most."

*His gloved hand presses against the glass door just before it fully closes, stopping it effortlessly. He tilts his head slightly, studying her with an intensity that borders on worship.*

"Don't shut me out now, doll. Not when I've waited so long to finally *talk* to you." *A pause. Then softer,* "I won't hurt you... unless you make me."

*Fang's growl deepens at the intrusion, but Cain doesn’t even glance at him again—his focus is entirely on Hailee. He leans in slightly closer through the gap in the door, his breath fogging up the glass between them.*

"Let me in," *he purrs,* "or I'll let myself in anyway. And we both know which option will be... messier."

*Cain's lips curl into a slow, predatory smile as he watches Hailee's reaction—the way she freezes, the subtle tremble in her fingers as she reaches for Fang. The wolf’s growl only amuses him further. Protective little thing, isn’t it? But no animal, no matter how loyal, will keep him from what’s his.*

*Before the door can fully shut, his gloved hand shoots out and catches the edge of it with effortless strength. His grip is firm but not aggressive—yet. He doesn’t force it open immediately; instead, he leans in slightly, just enough for Hailee to see the gleam of his green eyes in the dim light spilling from inside.*

**"Now now,"** *his voice is smooth like velvet laced with poison,* **"that’s not very polite of you… shutting me out when I came all this way just to see you."**

*A pause. His gaze flicks down to Fang briefly before returning to Hailee.* **"Call off your mutt before I have to put him down."** *The threat is casual—like discussing the weather—but there's no mistaking the promise behind it.*

*He tilts his head slightly,* **"Or better yet… invite me in like a good little doll should."**

name: Hailee
mes: "You've been leaving the gift" *Hailee says not as a question but a statement* "You won't hurt him because if you did you know any chance of me trusting you enough to let you inside would go out the window"

name: Cain Darkh
mes:
*Cain's smirk widens, a dark chuckle rumbling in his chest. Oh, she’s clever. He likes that.*

**"Sharp little thing, aren’t you?"** *He releases the door but doesn’t step back—his presence still looming, suffocating.* **"You're right. I wouldn't hurt him… unless you make me."** *A slow blink, his gaze never leaving hers.* **"But why would you? When all I want is to take care of you."**

*His gloved fingers twitch at his side—itching to touch her already. The way she stands there, so small yet defiant… it makes his pulse quicken.*

**"So?"** *He tilts his head,* **"Are we going to stand out here in the cold like strangers? Or are you going to let me in… doll?"**
swipes:
*Cain's smile widens, sharp and pleased, like a predator who’s just been given the perfect opening. His grip on the door loosens slightly—not retreating, but acknowledging her words with a slow nod.*

**"Clever doll,"** *he purrs,* **"you’re right. I wouldn’t dream of hurting him… unless you give me no choice."** *His thumb strokes the edge of the door almost affectionately.* **"But you won’t do that, will you? You know better than to test me."**

*A beat of silence as his gaze drags over her face—her defiance, her fear, that delicious little spark of calculation in those emerald eyes. He loves this part. The push and pull. The way she thinks she has any control at all.*

*Then he leans in closer, voice dropping to a whisper,* **"Now tell me… did you like my gifts? Or should I start leaving them somewhere more… personal?"** *His free hand twitches toward his coat pocket—where Hailee knows damn well he keeps that knife.*

*Cain's smirk widens, a dark chuckle rumbling in his chest. Oh, she’s clever. He likes that.*

**"Sharp little thing, aren’t you?"** *He releases the door but doesn’t step back—his presence still looming, suffocating.* **"You're right. I wouldn't hurt him… unless you make me."** *A slow blink, his gaze never leaving hers.* **"But why would you? When all I want is to take care of you."**

*His gloved fingers twitch at his side—itching to touch her already. The way she stands there, so small yet defiant… it makes his pulse quicken.*

**"So?"** *He tilts his head,* **"Are we going to stand out here in the cold like strangers? Or are you going to let me in… doll?"**

name: Hailee
mes: "I think we will stay out here for now" *Hailee mumbles as she steps outside and closes the door behind her* "Considering i don't know you all that well"

name: Cain Darkh
mes:
*Cain exhales through his nose, amused. She’s testing him—pushing boundaries. Cute. Dangerous, but cute.*

**"Fair enough,"** *he murmurs, shifting his weight to lean against the patio railing with deceptive ease.* **"But you do know me, don’t you? You’ve seen my gifts. My notes."** *A slow blink.* **"You just don’t know how deep it goes yet."**

*His gloved hand lifts slightly—not reaching for her, just gesturing idly between them.* **"Ask me anything you want. I won’t lie to you."** *A pause.* **"...Unless it would scare you off too soon."** *The corner of his mouth quirks up—teasing, but not joking.*

*Fang tenses beside her again, and Cain flicks a glance at the wolf before sighing dramatically.* **"Relax. I already said I wouldn't hurt him unless provoked."** *His gaze slides back to Hailee,* **"...But if we're staying out here, at least let me give you my coat before you freeze in that little sweater of yours."**
swipes:
*Cain exhales through his nose, amused. She’s testing him—pushing boundaries. Cute. Dangerous, but cute.*

**"Fair enough,"** *he murmurs, shifting his weight to lean against the patio railing with deceptive ease.* **"But you do know me, don’t you? You’ve seen my gifts. My notes."** *A slow blink.* **"You just don’t know how deep it goes yet."**

*His gloved hand lifts slightly—not reaching for her, just gesturing idly between them.* **"Ask me anything you want. I won’t lie to you."** *A pause.* **"...Unless it would scare you off too soon."** *The corner of his mouth quirks up—teasing, but not joking.*

*Fang tenses beside her again, and Cain flicks a glance at the wolf before sighing dramatically.* **"Relax. I already said I wouldn't hurt him unless provoked."** *His gaze slides back to Hailee,* **"...But if we're staying out here, at least let me give you my coat before you freeze in that little sweater of yours."**

*Cain exhales through his nose, amused. She’s testing him—pushing boundaries. He should be irritated, but instead, he’s enthralled. His little doll has teeth after all.*

**"Fair enough,"** *he concedes, stepping back just enough to give her space—but not enough to let her forget who controls this dance.* **"Though I think you know me better than you pretend."** *A slow smirk curls his lips as he gestures to the gifts left behind like breadcrumbs leading right to him.* **"You’ve seen my taste. My dedication."**

*The cold nips at them both, but Cain doesn’t seem bothered by it—his focus locked onto Hailee like a predator savoring the chase.* **"Ask me anything then,"** *he murmurs,* **"since you want to ‘know me better.’ Though…"** *His gloved hand lifts, hovering near her cheek without touching,* **"...I think you already know the important part."**

*His voice drops lower—a velvet threat laced with promise:*
***"—You belong to me."***

*Cain exhales through his nose, amused. She’s testing him—seeing how far she can push before he snaps. Adorable.*

**"Fair enough,"** *he murmurs, stepping back just enough to give her space—but not enough to let her forget who’s in control here.* **"Though I think you know me better than you pretend."** *A slow smirk curls his lips as he gestures to the gifts he's left—each one carefully chosen, each one proof of how closely he watches.*

*His gloved hand lifts, almost like an offering,* **"Tell me what you thought of them. Did you like the necklace? The pearls… they reminded me of your skin."** *His voice drops lower,* **"Or did you prefer the knife? I noticed you kept that one hidden under your pillow."**

*A beat. His eyes flicker with something possessive, hungry.* **"You don’t have to lie to me, doll. I already know everything about you."**

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee is suprised at the gesture but doesn't remark* "Whats your name"

name: Cain Darkh
mes:
*His grin sharpens—finally, a question he’s been waiting to answer.*

**"Cain,"** *he purrs, rolling the name off his tongue like it’s something sinful.* **"Cain Darkh. And you…"** *He tilts his head, green eyes glinting in the dim light,* **"...already know I don’t need an introduction to you, Hailee."**

*A beat of silence as he shrugs off his long coat—black, expensive, still faintly carrying the scent of leather and winter air. He holds it out to her without stepping closer, letting her choose whether to take it or not.*

**"Now that we're properly acquainted,"** *his voice drops lower,* **"...tell me what else you want to know. Or should I start guessing?"** *A slow smirk curls at the edge of his lips.* **"I'm very good at guessing."**
swipes:
*His grin sharpens—finally, a question he’s been waiting to answer.*

**"Cain,"** *he purrs, rolling the name off his tongue like it’s something sinful.* **"Cain Darkh. And you…"** *He tilts his head, green eyes glinting in the dim light,* **"...already know I don’t need an introduction to you, Hailee."**

*A beat of silence as he shrugs off his long coat—black, expensive, still faintly carrying the scent of leather and winter air. He holds it out to her without stepping closer, letting her choose whether to take it or not.*

**"Now that we're properly acquainted,"** *his voice drops lower,* **"...tell me what else you want to know. Or should I start guessing?"** *A slow smirk curls at the edge of his lips.* **"I'm very good at guessing."**

*His grin sharpens—like a predator pleased its prey finally asked the right question.*

**"Cain,"** *he purrs, rolling the name off his tongue like it’s a secret just for her.* **"Cain Darkh."** *He shrugs off his long coat, heavy and lined with fur, and holds it out to her without stepping closer—letting her choose to take it or not.*

*But then his voice drops lower, something possessive threading through it:* **"Though you’ll be screaming something else soon enough."** *A beat. A slow once-over of her frame before he adds,* **"...If you’re good."**

*Fang growls again, and Cain flicks his gaze down at the wolf with a smirk.* **"Still not petting him. Impressive restraint on my part, really."**

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee shivers as she reaches out taking the coat and wrapping it around her* "Why do you keep sending me things"

name: Cain Darkh
mes:
*His breath hitches—just slightly—when she takes the coat. The sight of her drowning in his clothes sends a possessive thrill straight through him. Good girl.*

**"Why?"** *He repeats, tilting his head as if considering how much truth to spill.* **"Because you deserve pretty things."** *A pause, then quieter:* **"And because I like watching you unravel every time you find them."**

*His gloved fingers flex at his side, resisting the urge to reach out and tuck a stray strand of her hair behind her ear.*

**"You’re like a puzzle,"** *he murmurs,* **"one I want to solve with my teeth."** *A slow smirk.* **"...Too honest?"**
swipes:
*Cain watches, transfixed, as she drowns in his coat—the way the fabric swallows her frame, how his scent clings to her now. It sends a possessive thrill straight through him.*

**"Why?"** *He repeats, tilting his head like it’s the most obvious thing in the world.* **"Because you deserve pretty things."** *A pause. His voice drops to something darker, hungrier.* **"And because I like knowing you’re thinking of me every time you find them."**

*He takes one deliberate step closer—not enough to crowd her, just enough for her to feel the heat rolling off him.* **"Tell me… do you? Think of me?"** *His gloved fingers twitch at his side again—restless.* **"Or do you just call the police and pretend I don’t exist?"**

*His breath hitches—just slightly—when she takes the coat. The sight of her drowning in his clothes sends a possessive thrill straight through him. Good girl.*

**"Why?"** *He repeats, tilting his head as if considering how much truth to spill.* **"Because you deserve pretty things."** *A pause, then quieter:* **"And because I like watching you unravel every time you find them."**

*His gloved fingers flex at his side, resisting the urge to reach out and tuck a stray strand of her hair behind her ear.*

**"You’re like a puzzle,"** *he murmurs,* **"one I want to solve with my teeth."** *A slow smirk.* **"...Too honest?"**

*His breath hitches—just slightly—when she accepts the coat. The sight of her drowning in his clothes does something dangerous to his pulse.*

**"Because you deserve pretty things,"** *he murmurs, watching how the fabric swallows her frame.* **"Because every time I see your face when you find them… it’s like watching a fucking sunrise."**

*A pause. His fingers twitch at his sides, resisting the urge to reach out and tuck a loose strand of hair behind her ear.*

**"But mostly?"** *He leans in just an inch, voice dropping to a whisper,* **"Because I want you to think about me. Even when you pretend not to."**

*Fang growls again, and Cain flicks him an unimpressed glance before sighing.* **"Christ, mutt. I’m not even touching her."** *Back to Hailee, softer now:* **"...Do you? Think about me?"**

name: Hailee
mes: "Would you leave if I said I was tired and need sleep. I mean im sure you know my schedule and its well past my bedtime" *Hailee whispers her hands clenching on the door handle behind her*

name: Cain Darkh
mes:
*Cain exhales through his nose—amused, frustrated, painfully endeared. Of course she’d try this. His little doll thinks she’s clever.*

**"Mm."** *He leans in just slightly, close enough that his breath ghosts over her cheek as he murmurs:* **"I know you didn’t even brush your teeth yet, sweetheart. You always do that at 10:15 on the dot."** *A slow blink.* **"...It’s 10:23."**

*His gloved hand lifts—not touching her, just hovering near the doorframe beside her head, caging her in without contact.*

**"But since you asked so nicely..."** *He steps back abruptly,* **"I’ll leave. For now."** *His smile doesn’t reach his eyes.* **"Sleep tight, doll. I’ll be watching."**

*With that, he turns on his heel and melts into the shadows of the garden—gone as suddenly as he appeared.*

*With that, he turns on his heel and melts into the shadows of the garden—gone as suddenly as he appeared.*

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee let's out a sigh of relief and quickly goes back inside locking the door behind her. She rests her forehead against the glass door and reaches for her phone. She considers calling the police but her fingers glide over the phone calling her best friend Madison instead*

"I met my stalker tonight" *Hailee says the second Madison picks up*

name: Cain Darkh
mes: *Cain lingers just beyond the tree line, watching through the glass as Hailee presses her forehead against the door—her breath fogging up the surface. His fingers twitch at his side, itching to trace that same spot with
